newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: MALAYSIA STOCKS - factors to watch - June 17.
newsitem.headline: MALAYSIA STOCKS - factors to watch - June 17.

text.p: Following are some of the main factors likely to affect Malaysian stocks on Tuesday:
* Composite Index of 100 blue chips off 0.98 points to 1,077.40 on Monday, recovering from lows with help from local fund buying. But 1,050 level being eyed for possible break, analysts say.
* Dow Jones snaps six-day record setting streak with 9.95 point loss to 7772.09 on Monday.
* Ringgit at 2.5155/65 a dollar at 1000 GMT on Monday against 2.5131/41 at close in Kuala Lumpur on Friday.

* "I think external sentiment on Malaysia (stocks) remains very negative," said Patrick Russell, managing director at W.I. Carr in Kuala Lumpur. He said the trade deficit for April, as well as worries about property and the banking sector were contributing to the bearish mood.
* But some stocks look attractive because of their cheap valuations, he said. Among his recommendations are Malaysian Airline, Genting Bhd, Technology Resources Industries, AMMB and TV3.
* In overnight news, Berjaya Land, reported its year net profit jumped to 104.74 million ringgit from 26.22 million a year ago.
